III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation About 3 weeks ago, two youth at facility engaged in sexual
intercourse.
Investigation Interviews:
Supervisor/Complaint Source was interviewed via phone on
May 17, 2023. Supervisor reported she received information from
Staff 1 of Youth A disclosing she had sexual intercourse with
another peer in the bathroom of the on-ground school. Supervisor
reported she talked with Youth A about the situation and Youth A
continued to switch the dates of this occurrence. First Youth A
reported this happened back in December, then it went from six
weeks ago to about three weeks ago. She reported Youth A
continued to change the name of the youth this was with as well.
Supervisor reported Youth A does not have any safety plan at this
time and has not had any concerns of sexualized behaviors.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on May 17, 2023. Staff 1
reported the other day, Youth A asked her to take her to get a
pregnancy test. She reported she asked Youth A why she would
need that, and she reported that she believes she may be
pregnant from having sex. Staff 1 reported Youth A disclosed the
first time she had sex was back in December and then recently
but did not have a specific date. Staff 1 reported Youth A at first
would not disclose who the youth was she had sex with but
eventually reported it was with Youth B in the bathroom at the
onsite school. Staff 1 reported Youth A has reported having a
crush on Youth B and has been known to exaggerate her stories.
She reported the unit also just had a sex education course with
the facility nursing staff which could have led her to believe she
was pregnant. Staff 1 reported she noted these concerns because
the facility has had issues with the school bathroom before not
being supervised. She reported the staff that works in the onsite
school are supposed to monitor when a youth goes to the
bathroom. Staff 1 reported she does not work in the school, so
she does not have first-hand knowledge of the protocol or what
supervision looks like.
2

Youth A’s Foster Care Worker was interviewed via phone on
May 17, 2023. Youth A’s Foster Care Worker reported Youth A
has never disclosed any sexual intercourse happening at the
facility and does not have a history of sexualized behaviors. She
reported she just met with Youth A at the facility to check in about
these allegations and Youth A was not being consistent with her
stories. Youth A’s Foster Care Worker stated Youth A stated that
at first, this happened back in December when she was not even
placed at the facility until March. She reported Youth A would not
disclose who the other youth was. Youth A reported to Youth A’s
Foster Care Worker that to use the bathroom at school, staff need
to unlock the door and would not disclose how the other youth got
into the bathroom. Youth A’s Foster Care Worker reported she
has no concerns with the facility and their supervision level. She
reported Youth A likes to exaggerate stories at times.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 17,
2023. Youth A reported she has been living at the facility since
March 2023 and things have been going well. She reported no
concerns about the staff's ability to perform their jobs or level of
supervision. Youth A reported due to the facility being a secure
setting, staff need to unlock her bedroom door and bathroom door,
including the classroom bathroom, in order for her to enter. When
asked about the reported allegations, Youth A reported she did
not want to talk about it at first. After some time, she reported she
had sex with another peer in the on-campus school bathroom
about three weeks ago. Youth A reported she did not want to say
who the youth was and could not confirm the date or who was
working when this occurred. When asked how she got into the
bathroom with the other youth, she reported she was going into
the bathroom, and he was coming out of the same bathroom and
there was no staff or other youth around. This consultant asked
Youth A what the process is when you need to use the bathroom
within the school, and she reported the youth has to raise their
hand first and then sign out to use the bathroom. Youth A
explained the staff walk with the youth to the bathroom and unlock
the door. The consultant asked Youth A if the staff let her into the
bathroom the day she had sex with the other youth and she
reported no she was coming out of the bathroom when the other
youth was coming out. The consultant asked her to confirm what
the true story was if she was walking in or out of the bathroom
when the other youth was in there to have sex. She then reported
she believes staff were distracted during the time it occurred
because staff is good at supervising, but they were sneaky with
the situation. Youth A reported she does not remember the whole
situation and she told Staff 1 that it just occurred because she was
3

concerned she was pregnant. She reported she was happy that
she was not pregnant and noted that she just learned about
getting pregnant through the sex education presented by nursing
last week. Youth A continued to report she did not want to
disclose who the youth was and reported she would not talk with a
detective if they came to the facility.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 17,
2023. Youth B reported that the staff do a good job of supervising
the youth at the facility. He reported he attends school on campus
and the classroom is set up so the youth cannot be next to
another peer. Youth B reported staff is always listening to the
youth's conversations and the youth cannot get away with
anything. He reported if a youth needs to use the bathroom during
school, the youth has to raise their hand and ask staff. Youth B
reported once the youth is given permission to get up they have to
sign out and staff will escort them to the bathroom. He stated staff
has to unlock the door and check the bathroom before a youth can
go in. Youth B reported he has never heard of anyone having sex
in that bathroom. He reported he does not know how that would
happen since staff have to unlock the door for you and staff do not
let youth be alone in the hallway when there is another youth out
there. He stated, “never have I tried or never will I have sex in that
bathroom.”
Education Coordinator, Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 4 were
separately interviewed face to face at the facility on May 17,
2023. Education Coordinator, Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 4 all
reported there is a procedure in place for when a youth needs to
use the restroom when within the classroom. Education
Coordinator supervises the staff that works within the classroom
and reported there have been no reported sexual behavior
concerns within the classroom with Youth A or any other youth.
Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 4 work in the specific classroom that
Youth A is placed in. They reported Youth A has not disclosed any
information about having sex with another youth in the bathroom
and does not know how that would be possible as the staff has to
unlock the bathroom and check the bathroom. Staff reported when
a youth needs to use a bathroom the youth is to raise their hand,
then sign out, and then staff escorts the youth to the bathroom,
then staff will unlock the door and check that there is no one in
there. Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 4 reported the rule is no youth to
be left unattended in the hallway and if there is a youth having
behavioral concerns, there is extra staff that get called to help with
the situation so there is never a time of no supervision. Staff 2,
Staff 3, and Staff 4 stated Youth A is not on any safety plan but
4

since the concern of these allegations, they are making sure she
is fully being escorted everywhere. The staff all reported no
concerns about other staff’s ability to supervise the youth.
Youth C and Youth D were separately interviewed face to face
at the facility on May 17, 2023. Youth C and Youth D reported
they are both in the same classroom as Youth A. They both
reported when a youth needs to use the restroom at the school,
they have to raise their hand and staff will give them the go-ahead
to sign out. Staff then escort the youth to the bathroom, unlock the
bathroom and check the bathroom before the youth can use it. No
two youth can be in the hallway alone and have to wait for the go-
ahead to use the bathroom one at a time. Youth C and Youth D
reported they have never heard of youth having sex in the
bathroom at the school. They both reported no concerns about
staff supervision.
Detective was interviewed via phone on May 17,
2023. Detective reported she is closing out her case since Youth
A is not willing to talk to her and there is no confirmation of who
the other youth was.
Tour Observation:
A tour of the facility occurred on May 17, 2023. Consultant was
able to view the area where Youth A attends school and where the
bathroom is located. The classroom hallway where the classroom
and bathroom area is located behind a locked door. Once the staff
is to open the locked door the youth bathroom is to the right and
the door was locked. On the right side is the spare classroom
called the “RCT” room where you can take a break and staff is
present. The main classroom is diagonally across from the locked
bathroom. In the classroom, there were youth at their desk that
were evenly spaced out and three staff members sitting in
different spots of the classroom. This consultant was able to see
the bathroom sign-out sheet that the youth use as well.
Documents Reviewed:
- Youth A’s File- Youth A was placed at the facility at the
beginning of March 2023. There were no active safety plans
resulting in increased supervision of Youth A prior to the report of
the allegations. On May 17, 2023, a safety plan was created with
Youth A, Youth A’s Foster Care Worker, and the facility’s
therapist, noting Youth A will not be left alone with male peers at
any time, she will be escorted to her room until completion of
sexual education course, and Youth A will participate in a sexual
education course. Youth A has developmental/intellectual needs
5

as she has an FSIQ of 62, which is within the very low range of
overall cognitive ability.
- Facility Procedure for School Bathroom Use- This procedure
documents the steps that need to occur when a youth at the
onsite school needs to use the restroom. The procedure notes:
“Client will raise their hand in the classroom to ask to use the
bathroom; Staff will ensure there is no another client in the
restroom and will then approve for the client to use the bathroom;
Client will then sign out to use the bathroom on the appropriate
sign-out sheet in the classroom; staff will then walk with the client
to the bathroom; staff will knock on the bathroom door, then
unlock the bathroom; Staff checks the bathroom (no other client is
in the bathroom, checking trash cans, checking surrounding areas
for notes, vapes writing on walls, or other contraband); If another
client is in the hallway while the client is in the bathroom, staff will
continue to provide supervision in the hallway to ensure that two
clients are never alone together.”
-Bathroom sign-out sheet- The sign out sheet that is used for
the classroom has the date, time, student signature, staff checking
off bathroom was okay before and after youth’s usage, and the
staff’s initials. The bathroom log sheets were reviewed from the
date of 04/27/2023 to 05/17/2023. From reviewing the log there is
at least five minutes between each sign out time of the youth that
needed to use the restroom. Within the review on 05/01/2023,
Youth A signed out to use the restroom about five minutes after
her return, Youth B signed out by staff to use the restroom and
then another youth was signed out to use the restroom after.
From reviewing the documentation, it appears to be within in
compliance of the agency policy.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with staff following the
supervision procedure for the school bathroom. The staff and
youth both reported a youth needs to ask staff first to use the
restroom and staff have to unlock the bathroom door and check
the bathroom prior to a youth entering the bathroom. Youth A
would not disclose full details of what occurred, and her reporting
was inconsistent.
Technical assistance
Technical assistance was provided to the facility about their
bathroom sign-out sheet to potentially add a time slot for when the
youth return from the restroom where either the youth or staff
completes that portion.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be continued.
